  • Constructor Details

    • ServerThread

      public ServerThread​(java.net.Socket socket, Server server, int numPlayers, boolean maxPlayerNumberSet)
      This class is a thread create by the server. Each client has its own Thread. The thread is the real gate between the Server and the Client.
      Parameters:
      socket - socket
      server - server
      numPlayers - numPlayers
      maxPlayerNumberSet - maxPlayerNumberSet

    • run

      public void run()
      out and in are the channels used to communicate with the clients if this is the first client, request the number of players if the number of connected clients is greater than the number of maximum players allowed, then a message is sent to that client notifying of this event otherwise view and controller are set the attribute KeepAlive is used to manage the thread. If KeepAlive = true, then the thread runs and continues to accept new packets If KeepAlive = false, then the thread stops
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread

    • sendToClient
